text: Scirpophaga nepalensis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Angoon Lewvanich in 1981. It is found in Nepal. The wingspan is 16.5–18 mm for males and 16.5-18.5 mm for females. The forewings of the males are ochreous yellow, but darker along the venations. There is a fuscous spot at the lower angle of the cell. The hindwings are pale ochreous white. The forewings of the females are pale ochreous white with a dark fuscous spot at the lower angle of the cell. The hindwings are pale ochreous white with an ochreous-yellow anal tuft."Two new species of the genus Scirpophaga from Nepal (Lepidoptera: Pyralidae: Schoenobiinae)". ==References== Category:Moths described in 1981 Category:Schoenobiinae Category:Moths of Asia
title: Scirpophaga nepalensis
